etymology.description: 甲(甲) (jiǎ, 'armor') as semantic component + 丷(丷) (bā, 'eight') as phonetic component = phonetic support -> sound 'dān'
etymology.interpretation: The character 単(單) (dān) primarily serves as a phonetic component. The semantic component, similar to 甲(甲) (jiǎ, 'armor'), gives a hint to its ancient origins related to structure or protection. Over time, its use has expanded, primarily capturing the phonetic aspect due to 丷(丷) (bā, 'eight').

examples.chinese: 在汉字构造中(在漢字構造中)，单(單)作为声旁发挥作用(作為聲旁發揮作用)。
examples.pinyin: Zài hànzì gòuzào zhōng, dān zuòwéi shēngpáng fāhuī zuòyòng.
examples.english: In the structure of Chinese characters, dān functions as the phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 这个字的发音来自于(這個字的發音來自於)，单(單)的音韵提示(的音韻提示)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì de fāyīn láizì yú, dān de yīnyùn tíshì.
examples.english: The pronunciation of this character comes from the phonetic cue provided by dān.

examples.chinese: 古代字书中(古代字書中)，常用单(常用單)作为表示读音的符号(作爲表示讀音的符號)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài zìshū zhōng, chángyòng dān zuòwéi biǎoshì dúyīn de fúhào.
examples.english: In ancient dictionaries, dān was commonly used as a symbol to indicate pronunciation.
